patch 8.2.1419: Vim9: not operator applied too early

Problem:    Vim9: not operator applied too early.
Solution:   Implement the "numeric_only" argument. (closes #6680)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.1419: Vim9: not operator applied too early · vim/vim@59eccb9
attachments.title: patch 8.2.1419: Vim9: not operator applied too early · vim/vim@59eccb9
attachments.text: Problem: Vim9: not operator applied too early. Solution: Implement the "numeric_only" argument. (closes #6680)

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/8294d49937b99067522fda8a9399bb9533e3c44e|patch 8.2.1418: Vim9: invalid error for missing white space>
patch 8.2.1418: Vim9: invalid error for missing white space

Problem:    Vim9: invalid error for missing white space after function.
Solution:   Do not skip over white space. (closes #6679)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.1418: Vim9: invalid error for missing white space · vim/vim@8294d49
attachments.title: patch 8.2.1418: Vim9: invalid error for missing white space · vim/vim@8294d49
attachments.text: Problem: Vim9: invalid error for missing white space after function. Solution: Do not skip over white space. (closes #6679)

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/3e06a1e2a8c0854c881574f33363e00264db1f1d|patch 8.2.1416: Vim9: boolean evaluation does not work as intended>
patch 8.2.1416: Vim9: boolean evaluation does not work as intended

Problem:    Vim9: boolean evaluation does not work as intended.
Solution:   Use tv2bool() in Vim9 script. (closes #6681)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.1416: Vim9: boolean evaluation does not work as intended · vim/vim@3e06a1e
attachments.title: patch 8.2.1416: Vim9: boolean evaluation does not work as intended · vim/vim@3e06a1e
attachments.text: Problem: Vim9: boolean evaluation does not work as intended. Solution: Use tv2bool() in Vim9 script. (closes #6681)

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/6f8f7337c1211692d508239eb4cbc8a6f67de497|patch 8.2.1415: closing a popup window with CTRL-C interrupts 'status…>
patch 8.2.1415: closing a popup window with CTRL-C interrupts 'statusline'

Problem:    Closing a popup window with CTRL-C interrupts 'statusline' if it
            calls a function.
Solution:   Reset got_int while redrawing. (closes #6675)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.1415: closing a popup window with CTRL-C interrupts 'status… · vim/vim@6f8f733
attachments.title: patch 8.2.1415: closing a popup window with CTRL-C interrupts 'status… · vim/vim@6f8f733
attachments.text: …line' Problem: Closing a popup window with CTRL-C interrupts 'statusline' if it calls a function. Solution: Reset got_int while redrawing. (closes #6675)

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/bf61fdd00808bfa7cc61a82c719fc220bba50ba3|patch 8.2.1414: popupwindow missing last couple of lines>
patch 8.2.1414: popupwindow missing last couple of lines

Problem:    Popupwindow missing last couple of lines when cursor is in the
            first line.
Solution:   Compute the max height also when top aligned. (closes #6664)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.1414: popupwindow missing last couple of lines · vim/vim@bf61fdd
attachments.title: patch 8.2.1414: popupwindow missing last couple of lines · vim/vim@bf61fdd
attachments.text: Problem: Popupwindow missing last couple of lines when cursor is in the first line. Solution: Compute the max height also when top aligned. (closes #6664)

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/94f4ffa7704921a3634e56b878e6dc362bc3d508|patch 8.2.1413: previous tab page not usable from an Ex command>
patch 8.2.1413: previous tab page not usable from an Ex command

Problem:    Previous tab page not usable from an Ex command.
Solution:   Add the "#" argument for :tabnext et al. (Yegappan Lakshmanan,
            closes #6677)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.1413: previous tab page not usable from an Ex command · vim/vim@94f4ffa
attachments.title: patch 8.2.1413: previous tab page not usable from an Ex command · vim/vim@94f4ffa
attachments.text: Problem: Previous tab page not usable from an Ex command. Solution: Add the "#" argument for :tabnext et al. (Yegappan Lakshmanan, closes #6677)
